content: sunflower pin crochet pattern for those with hidden disabilities and their allies skill level beginner friendly abbreviations u s terminology materials required mc magic_ring yellow yarn slip_stitch slipstitch brown yarn chain - chain crochet hook size appropriate to yarn single_crochet single_crochet choice increase increase single_crochet increase yarn needle double_crochet double_crochet optional safety pin or pin fastener tc triple crochet optional hot glue gun popcorn picot ch3 slip_stitch into 1st chain blo/flo back loop only/front loop only xxxx instructions within the brackets are worked into the same stitch this is an original pattern written by hannah tutton of @bestitchednz intended to raise awareness to those who live with hidden disabilities it is prohibited to alter or translate this pattern for re-sale while this pattern is available for free it is encouraged for you to make a small donation to a charity of your choice pattern notes turning chains do not count as stitches this is a great scrap yarn buster project as only small amounts of yarn are required if you are not making this into a sunflower pin simply stop before the pin instructions you can continue without using hot glue by leaving a long tail and sewing instead of gluing to make this the right size to be pins on my lanyard i used 4ply crochet tread and a 2mm crochet hook you can use whatever yarn and hook size you wish but this will make your finished sunflower larger or smaller depending flower centre with brown yarn 1 8sc in magic_ring slip_stitch to repeat from * until the end of the round working your slip_stitch into the base of the starting ch2 8 petals 2 **work this round into blo** ch3 * 2tc popcorn 2tc ch3 slip_stitch into next single_crochet* repeat from * until end of the round working your slip_stitch into the base of the starting ch3 8 tall petals fasten_off leave a short tail long enough to weave in sepal with brown 1
